title: The last honest words i'll have to say on this account. see you later hypocritical game.
body:
So this account is now permanently banned.
why? 
because riot someone has double standards for people like me.

I started playing this game at the end of 2015 and absolutely adored it and couldn't think of a way to hate it. 
its a great game it really is! 
but this shitty..... bullshit... double standard way of banning people honestly makes me think fuck it. why love a game that is ran by lazy ignorant people. 

when i first started playing i thought "how can people even be toxic in this game? the lore is awesome the characters are unbelievably fun to play how can this be a thing".
Then i got my first chat ban, why? 
Support - go neck yourself you missed the cannon minion you trash adc
me - why would i go neck myself over a cannon minion? there is plenty more to come
support - i bet you're an Aussie pig aren't you
me - how a Aussie's pigs? we let all you foreign people in here and yet you all treat us - the people that let you in this country- like dogs????
support - you're a dog , you're all dogs go kill yourself
me- you shouldn't tell people to go neck themselves.

I get chat restricted, He is still playing. 
i don't know if he also got chat restricted but the point still remains. i wanted to stop this hate within one person and i get punished for this shit. 

As time goes on and people tell me tell me to die, i'm useless, i'm wasting my time playing this game, i'm a %%%got,  this that, that this.... i become one of them, i become the meme... because i report them, they still play, and then finally i call someone a bundle of sticks... i call someone a %%%got. not even in the way you'd call someone a %%%got, literally used it in a sentence that would explain how dumb someone is.. then 10 seconds after the game has ended, i get my first 14 day suspension and the 2 fuck faces that pushed me over the edge by taking my farm and inting get nothing! why? because they didnt call me a homo but they did get to call me every other thing under this sun. they walk away, and i get this ban.

so finally im here. $700 on this account gone in the wind. $5000 on my main that is currently on a 14 day suspension because someone told me to neck myself and i said i hope they drop dead after this game (that player is still playing btw). $1500 on my lowest elo account that has lvl4 honor and $300 on my try hard account that has lvl3 honor. well $750 on this account because i spent 50 before i got this account perna banned.

defending yourself with passion isn't allowed. defending yourself at all isn't allowed. explaining how to win a game isn't allowed. gaining elo isn't allowed. showing how much better you are than the people that represent your region isn't allowed. explaining yourself on boards isn't allowed. asking a riot employee to disable my chat isn't allowed (support card closed after i asked this). liking this game isn't allowed. 

and before you say "hit the mute button" and lick a window - why is there even a chat in low elo? i mean... theres only low golds and lower that are even on the boards and you're only in boards to voice your opinion, so you must only be low elo because you talk to much.

If that was all you'd said for your first punishment, I'd call that a false positive. There is some racism there (why does it matter if he's foreign or not, he's an ass plain and simple) but imo it would not be anywhere near enough to net you a punishment as a first offence and you should have persisted with an appeal. 

He more than likely got chat restricted too. I don't know how long ago that was with regards to the introduction of the no tolerance policy that escalated that kind of chat to instant 14 day.

If players are telling you those things, and are still playing (not receiving 14 days) then frankly they shouldn't be, and you should be reporting those players through support (Tier 1 support is the customised macro, if you aren't satisfied just reply to the ticket).

Defending yourself isn't the same as firing back. If you are partaking in the same behaviour, then you face the same punishments. Defending yourself is fine, retaliation is not.

>explaining how to win a game isn't allowed. gaining elo isn't allowed. showing how much better you are than the people that represent your region isn't allowed. explaining yourself on boards isn't allowed....liking this game isn't allowed.

All of these things *are* allowed, it's how you go about them. Telling someone they're an idiot because they ignored your baron call is very different from explaining why you made the call. Expecting people to follow your lead and then lashing out at them when they don't is very different from giving them a reason to follow. 

Breaking the Boards rules is not the same as laying out your point of view. You are allowed to be pissed off, disgruntled and disillusioned. You are allowed to disagree with Riot or us or other players. It is when you cross the line into abuse or break any of the other rules that you are no longer explaining or discussing and moderation has a responsibility to shut things down.

Permanent chat bans are not a thing for one main reason: They don't work. It only hides the behaviour and does not encourage reform, and chat restrictions are primarily warnings. There are some players that it may benefit certainly, but that number is miniscule compared to the players it wouldn't, it's not a scaleable compromise.

It sucks having toxic players in your game, but if their behaviour is so bad why do you deserve a free pass for the same? Why should the community tolerate people creating *more* toxicity just because 'someone else started it'. Why should the community allow grown ass players (M rated) to use a child's excuse for their behaviour? Consider your behaviour from the perspective of the positive and neutral players on your teams.

If you get hit for quoting someone else, appeal it. If you get punished for saying some bs in chat, own it. If you disagree with the rules the community has set, either realise you'll have to adhere to them to stay, or move onto another game.

as of 2009 ( that number can only increase) 67 million people are playing or have accounts that means 6700 people are in that 0.01% guess they dont matter and are meaningless?

*From a practical perspective*. That number is global,  and those few players affected can very easily go through support, and such unusual cases aid the machine learning component as well.

If someone comes to boards with a racist chat log there isn't much point telling them that false positives exist. If someone doesn't know about support then that's also an easy fix, and "How do I appeal a false punishment" is much more likely to inspire benefit of the doubt than "I was banned for no reason [insert spiel about bad teammates here]" is.

From your own example of "I reported some people who annoyed me and got the notification", there are many much more likely events that would lead to that same scenario so false positive isn't going to be the first conclusion drawn.

The point being, false positives are _practically_ non-existent. In my entire time on boards I've only seen 2 confirmed (and plenty claimed that turned out to be very much not false), so without some pretty compelling factors in play, there isn't really any point to mentioning false positives as anything more than a footnote.
